verses.verse: ((1 Because God withdrew not his rods from his Church after their return from Babylon, first they put him in mind of their deliverance, to the intent that he should not leave the work of his grace imperfect.5 Next they complain of their long affliction.8 And thirdly, they rejoice in hope of felicity promised.9 For their deliverance was a figure of Christ’s kingdom, under the which should be perfect felicity.) ) Lord, thou hast been favorable unto thy land: thou hast brought again the captivity of Jacob.
Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, and (Thou hast buried them that they shall not come into judgment.) covered all their sins. Selah.
Thou hast withdrawn all thine anger, and hast turned back from the (Not only in withdrawing thy rod, but in forgiving of sins, and in touching our hearts to confess them.) fierceness of thy wrath.
Turn us, O God of our salvation, and release thine anger toward us.

Wilt thou be angry with us (As in times past they had felt God’s mercies, so now being oppressed by the long continuance of evils, they pray unto God that according to his nature he would be merciful unto them.) forever? and wilt thou prolong thy wrath from one generation to another?
Wilt thou not turn again and quicken us, that thy people may rejoice in thee?
Show us thy mercy, O Lord, and grant us thy (He confesseth that our salvation cometh only of God’s mercy.) salvation.

I will hearken what the Lord God will say: for he will speak (He will send all prosperity to his Church, when he hath sufficiently corrected them, also by his punishments the faithful shall learn to beware that they return not like offences.) peace unto his people, and to his Saints, that they turn not again to folly.
Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy and truth shall meet, righteousness and peace shall kiss one another.

(Though for a time God thus exerciseth them with his rods, yet under the kingdom of Christ they should have peace and joy.) Truth shall bud out of the earth, and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Yea, the Lord shall give good things, and our land shall give her increase.
(Justice shall then flourish, and have free course and passage in every place.) Righteousness shall go before him, and shall set her steps in the way.
